intro: Klasea centauroides subsp. chanetii, commonly known as the Chanetii spurge, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its adaptability and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
